8/ Blockchain bloat directly undermines censorship resistance and leads to centralization. In my opinion Ethereum has a huge problem there.pic.twitter.com/lKePjhBWCK
6/ Ethereum’s blockchain, after 2 years of operation, is now 196 GB large, and grew in the last year by 650%.
5/ Bitcoin’s blockchain, after 8 years of operation, is now 152 GB large, and grew in the last year by 50%.
4/ In crypto, it’s imperative that bandwidth load is kept minimal - otherwise censorship resistance evaporates and MYSQL is just as good.
3/ The messages that cryptocurrencies distribute are financial transactions, secured by proof of work and stored forever on a blockchain.
1/ Cryptocurrency is financial free speech, enforced by a censorship resistant distributed ledger.

Bitcoin mining is perfect for consuming marginal watts: excess capacity from hydro-electricity, natural gas, etc. So very low footprint.
E.g. it would be too expensive for a predator imposter or for a crippled peacock to try and mimic the feather display of a healthy peacock.
In nature just as with Bitcoin, doing work can be the best way to prove that you're not an imposter and that incentives are aligned.
